    • Method Detail

      • onReady

        public void onReady()
        Description copied from interface: Spark.Callbacks
        called when a connection to the background service is established. Only after this event has been thrown calls can be made.
        Specified by:
        onReady in interface Spark.Callbacks

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()
        Description copied from interface: Spark.Callbacks
        when the service is killed or exiting. This is intended to let the program know that the retrieved api object is no longer valid.
        Specified by:
        onDestroy in interface Spark.Callbacks

      • onJSONEventsChanged

        public void onJSONEventsChanged(java.util.List<java.lang.String> events)
        Description copied from interface: Spark.Callbacks
        The list of events reported by the Spark was changed (either from the lighter, or for some external reason). The current "version" of the events list is attached to this function. Events are stored as ISO-formatted Date Strings.
        Specified by:
        onJSONEventsChanged in interface Spark.Callbacks
        Parameters:
        events - list of JSONObject packed as strings, these objects contain a beg, end, and an id for each event. Times are encoded as ISO-standard times.

      • onEventsChanged

        public void onEventsChanged(java.util.List<Spark.Event> events)
        Description copied from interface: Spark.Callbacks
        The same as onEventsChanged, but events are returned as Spark Event objects.
        Specified by:
        onEventsChanged in interface Spark.Callbacks
        Parameters:
        events - list of Spark Events

      • onNewSpark

        public void onNewSpark(java.lang.String addr)
        Description copied from interface: Spark.Callbacks
        called when a Spark is seen, while no address has been set yet. This only works as long as the UI is in the foreground and is the equivalent of a Bluetooth Scan to detect new devices. Use this to get and set the address of the Spark you wish to connect to.
        Specified by:
        onNewSpark in interface Spark.Callbacks
        Parameters:
        addr - bluetooth address of the device.

      • onBrownout

        public void onBrownout(boolean batEmpty)
        Description copied from interface: Spark.Callbacks
        called when a Brownout was detected, i.e. the battery is flat and needs to be replaced. This is currently the only to get some indication on the battery status of the device.
        Specified by:
        onBrownout in interface Spark.Callbacks
        Parameters:
        batEmpty - true if the battery is empty

      • onStatusChanged

        public void onStatusChanged(int status)
        Description copied from interface: Spark.Callbacks
        called when the status of the service changes, for example when Bluetooth is deactivated. The Status is an or'red combination of @see Status.
        Specified by:
        onStatusChanged in interface Spark.Callbacks
        Parameters:
        status - or'red combination of @see Status flags
